article_title: This Netflix-themed scam prompts FTC to issue warning
short_description: The message starts off with the kind of information that is apt to send shivers down the spines of many binge-watchers
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: Ransomware vs. printing press? US newspapers face “foreign cyberattack”
short_description: Did malware disrupt newspaper deliveries in major US cities? Here’s what’s known about the incident so far and the leading suspect: Ryuk ransomware. Plus, advice on defending your organization against such attacks.
author: Stephen Cobb

article_title: 2018: Research highlights from ESET’s leading lights
short_description: As the curtain slowly falls on yet another eventful year in cybersecurity, let’s look back on some of the finest malware analysis by ESET researchers in 2018
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: Analysis of the latest Emotet propagation campaign
short_description: An analysis of the workings of this new Emotet campaign, which has affected various countries in Latin America by taking advantage of Microsoft Office files to hide its malicious activity
author: Diego Perez

article_title: What should you do with your old devices
short_description: Disposal of old tech requires thought and effort and the need to cleanse the device of any personal data is just one of the concerns
author: Tony Anscombe

article_title: SPARE: Five tips for a safer online shopping experience
short_description: There is still some time left to pick up some last-minute shopping before it’s too late but in the rush to do so don’t forget to do it safely
author: Editor

article_title: Google’s policy change reduces security, privacy and safety for 75% of users of ESET’s Android anti-theft service
short_description: The unfortunate implications of a well-intentioned change to Google Play Developer policies – and the negative impact it has on ESET’s Android app customers
author: Tony Anscombe

article_title: Microsoft issues emergency fix for Internet Explorer zero-day
short_description: Details are sparse about a security hole that Microsoft said is being exploited in targeted attacks
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: Holiday online shopping special tips
short_description: Some useful advice for staying safe while hunting for bargains in this holiday season
author: Tony Anscombe

article_title: NASA fears hackers may have stolen employee data
short_description: A probe launched immediately after the discovery of the suspected incident has yet to establish the scale of the potential damage
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: Target targeted: Five years on from a breach that shook the cybersecurity industry
short_description: In December 2013 news broke that Target suffered a breach that forced consumers and the cybersecurity community to question the security practices of retailers
author: Lysa Myers

article_title: Cybersecurity Trends 2019: Privacy and intrusion in the global village
short_description: With just days left in 2018, ESET experts offer their reflections in ‘Cybersecurity Trends 2019’ on themes that are set to figure prominently in the upcoming year
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: The most popular passwords of 2018 revealed: Are yours on the list?
short_description: Besides the usual suspects among the worst of passwords, a handful of notable – but similarly poor – choices make their debuts
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: How to protect yourself as the threat of scam apps grows
short_description: As the threat of bogus apps continues, what can we do to protect ourselves against these fraudulent practices?
author: Lysa Myers

article_title: Week in security with Tony Anscombe
short_description: Android Trojan steals money from PayPal accounts, the next generation of Dark Markets, and the Google+ to shut down earlier after new bug
author: Shane Curtis

article_title: Malaysian government targeted with mash-up espionage toolkit
short_description: An interview with ESET researchers Tomáš Gardoň and Filip Kafka on their research of a malware toolkit used in espionage against the Malaysian government
author: Editor

article_title: Google+ to shut earlier as new bug exposed data of 52.5 million users
short_description: There is no evidence that the flaw was misused during the six days it was alive, said the tech giant
author: Tomáš Foltýn

article_title: Android Trojan steals money from PayPal accounts even with 2FA on
short_description: ESET researchers discovered a new Android Trojan using a novel Accessibility-abusing technique that targets the official PayPal app, and is capable of bypassing PayPal’s two-factor authentication
author: Lukas Stefanko

article_title: Next Generation Dark Markets? Think Amazon or eBay for criminals
short_description: The “evolution” of these markets is making cybercrime easier than ever before
author: Stephen Cobb

article_title: Week in security with Tony Anscombe
short_description: DanaBot operators have been expanding the malware’s scope with new spam-sending capability. ESET researchers discovered a set of previously undocumented Linux malware families based on OpenSSH. Plus fitness-tracking apps use dodgy in-app payments to steal money from unaware iPhone and iPad users
author: Shane Curtis
